滶字的基本解释

滶
áo
古河名，源出中国河南省，流入汝水。

滶字的汉语字典释义

[①]［áo］
［《廣韻》五勞切，平豪，疑。］
古水名。即今石河。源出今河南省鲁山县西北谷积山，东流至宝丰县西北入汝水。

滶字的康熙字典解释

【巳集上】【水字部】　滶； 康熙笔画：15； 页码：页644第06
【唐韻】五勞切【集韻】牛刀切，?音敖。水名。【說文】水出南陽魯陽，入城父。

滶字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
滶字的起名意思

暂无。

Wan
Basic explanation of words
Wan
áo
The name of the ancient river originates from Henan Province, China, and flows into Rushui.
Wan
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①] [áo]
["Guangyun" Five hard work, Pinghao, doubt. ]
Ancient water name. Now Shihe. It originated from Guji Mountain in the northwest of Lushan County, Henan Province, and flows east to the northwest of Baofeng County into Rushui.
Wan
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Volume 1] [Water Word Department] 　滶; Kangxi Strokes: 15; Page Number: Page 644 06
[Tang Yun] Five labor cuts [Ji Yun] cut with a great knife,? Yinao. Water name. [Said the text] Water flows out of Nanyang Luyang, enters the city father.
Wan
